website_summaries.verdict: If you need lots of extra storage space in a compact package, the LaCie D2 Thunderbolt 2 is a great accessory for your Thunderbolt 2-enabled Macs.
pros: The LaCie D2 Thunderbolt 2 has top storage space, fast performance and the option of hosting an SSD Upgrade drive within its compact design
The drive supports both Thunderbolt 2 and USB 3.0
cons: the SSD Upgrade kit is hard to install and will remove the USB 3.0 port.

customer_reviews.title: I have daisy chained three drives using Thunderbolt. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have daisy chained three drives using Thunderbolt. I have had two in series for the past two years without a problem. When I added this third drive my system abnormally shuts down. This has happened numerous times. It quit when I removed the drive from the mix. I rate this a 4 because it's not the fault of this drive for the ab-end (or at least I don't think it is) and the other unit I have that is identical works well
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Great external drive
customer_reviews.text: Great external drive. I use this 6T unit as backup for both my MAC Mini and a 3T iPhone/iTunes external drive. Caveat: seems to run warm. I've mounted the Mini and both drives on a small rack (along with a battery backup unit) with a small fan...which is more than enough to cool everything.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Socha

customer_reviews.title: Great external drive - Very speedy and Extremely Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: The 7200rpm Drive with the Thunderbolt connection is wonderful. It is a fast drive and very quiet as well. Very pleased with this External Hard Drive. Thank you LaCie for a great item. Fast fast fast!!
customer_reviews.author: Bman2912

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product and brand.
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I got a second one as a mirror backup. Several techies recommended LaCie as a good, reliable brand. The blue light on this might bother some folks, but I have mine on my desk backwards so the light flashes against the wall, and it only flashes when it is processing something. Sleek, compact, nice design.
customer_reviews.author: BGuhl

customer_reviews.title: Solid, spectacular drive, so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful drive; quiet and powerful, great looking and hopefully will perform as brilliantly as it's designed. Perfectly packaged, arrived quickly and in pristine condition. Factory perfect. Will follow up if there are any performance issues. Too soon to make any pronouncements.
customer_reviews.author: P M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drives. Very happy with their performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drives. Very happy with their performance. I get data transfer rates of 2 Gigabytes per second from my 2015 15" Retina MacBook Pro Thunderbolt 2 ports. Would recommend this drive to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: RoyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hard drive for editing 4k+ video.
customer_reviews.text: I love this drive. I have been using it as a working drive for 4k RAW files and have had 0 problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: John Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Surprise
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you use the setup program to avoid complications. Other drives I have purchased just plugged in and worked, but this required using a setup program to clean up some formatting that was done by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Fluidguy

customer_reviews.title: LaCie Thunderbolt
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's supposed to so far. Fast enough for video editing using Thunderbolt. Wish there was more leeway in partitioning it but that's a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: Great and Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drive for the money. I can't say enough about these drives. I own three now and they are working great.
customer_reviews.author: Jose M. Altonaga

customer_reviews.title: good hardware to use
customer_reviews.text: What a thing! I bought this for me, I use it to make backup for my mac and RMBP, good hardware to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chen YANG

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very fast, no problem handling 4k video. Will update after I've had more time to use.
customer_reviews.author: BeachTV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome external drive!! Absolutely love this thing for my iMac. I'm a graphic designer and filmmaker and this thing can keep up with my demands.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Get This HDD
customer_reviews.text: Speed is awesome. Unit is cool and quiet. I think it is best thunderbolt hdd on market
customer_reviews.author: JackR

customer_reviews.title: Faulty thunderbolt controller
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with the quality of this drive. After setup I tried to backup some files and then suddenly during copying process my Macbook Pro 2014 freezes up and goes to restart. Since that it kept freezing all the time when working with the drive. However I found that it works fine through USB interface. Went to Apple store's Genius Bar and have verified with their technicians that this is thunderbolt controller issue in the drive. Returning back and hope the next one will be good one.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: using thunderbolt crashes my computer when copying large files but the usb works fine
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: this drive is fast when it works It worked for ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these about 3 months apart both failed after less than 2 months use. Lacie would not replace,

customer_reviews.title: Gr8 Drive!
customer_reviews.text: Great external drive as expected - LaCie makes a consistently amazing and dependable product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Richard Jones 11

customer_reviews.title: Working through some issues with sleep mode. The unit ...
customer_reviews.text: Working through some issues with sleep mode. The unit is inconsistent in powering up/waking up. Hopefully Lacie can help troubleshoot to resolve. As a noteworthy item, I am using BootCamp with OSX and Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Good, Big, Fast Thunderbolt 2 Drive
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Have it running on a Asus ThunderboltEX II expansion card. Haven't benchmarked it, but seems fast.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this drive so far
customer_reviews.text: Very fast access and write times. Very pleased with this drive so far.

customer_reviews.title: good but...

customer_reviews.title: 0 but it gets SUPER hot. Worried it's not going to last
customer_reviews.text: This works well with my 2013 Mac Pro connected either TB or USB 3.0 but it gets SUPER hot. Worried it's not going to last.

customer_reviews.title: LaCie keeps getting better
customer_reviews.text: Like a dream. The new size is perfect for any desk or table and is portable when necessary.

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after just 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Mine crashed after just 4 years. Couldn't get anything back using Seagates's software. It's a Seagate product.

product_meta.title: LaCie d2 Thunderbolt-2 & USB 3.0 Desktop Hard Drive 6TB (9000472U)
product_meta.description: With the new d2, LaCie again raised the bar on the industry's most trusted desktop storage product. Get the job done faster - on any computer - with dual Thunderbolt 2, USB 3.0, and a 7200 RPM Seagate hard disk. Thanks to its innovative, all-aluminum unibody design, you'll notice incredibly low vibration and operating noise. It's even possible to push speeds to up to five times faster by installing the LaCie d2 SSD Upgrade (sold separately). With best-in-class speed, versatility, and durability, the new LaCie d2 sets a new standard for desktop storage. The new LaCie d2 combines Thunderbolt 2 and USB 3.0 interfaces to deliver the best possible speeds when connected to any late-model PC or Mac computer. Dual Thunderbolt 2 ports let you daisy chain up to six devices to a single Thunderbolt port on a computer. This means that you could connect up to five LaCie d2 plus a 4K display to an iMac computer's Thunderbolt 2 port, bringing remarkable scalability and convenience to 4K or other workflows. And since USB 3.0 and Thunderbolt 2 are backward compatible, you always get the absolute fastest speeds your computer allows.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars48 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
